ost_step.3: Solving $x^2+3x-4=0$, we use quadratic formula or factorization. Factorizing, we get $(x+4)(x-1)=0$, so the roots are $x=-4$ and $x=1$. These are potential candidates. However, since absolute value ensures non-negativity, neither root makes any expression negative; hence no issues here.
ost_step.4: Similarly solving $x^2+9x+20=0$ leads us to $(x+5)(x+4)=0$, giving us another pair of possible candidate roots, namely $x=-5$ & $x=-4$. But again due to absolute value being always >= 0 , none problems arise here either. Thus, even though x may equate zero based purely off original function but it won’t make f undefined according to conditions mentioned above . Hence conclusion drawn : No Value Excluded From Domain - Every Real Number Can Possibly Have An Image Under Given Function !!!
